revised_title: Observations of Parhelia or Mock-Suns and Their Atmospheric Conditions
tldr: The author observed two parhelia, or mock-suns, in Wittemberg, Saxony, on December 31, 1735. They described the appearance, colors, and streams associated with the parhelia and the atmospheric conditions during the observation. The author also mentioned the similarity between their observations and those made in England, suggesting a similar state of the atmosphere in both locations.
